content: Wonyeol Lee Wonyeol Lee Assistant Professor, Computer Science, POSTECH Foundations of Programming & Computing Lab wonyeol.lee.cs@gmail.com | CV I am actively recruiting motivated students, including undergraduate interns (과제연구, 연구참여 등). Ideal students have a background in programming languages / mathematics, and an interest in programs / computations. If you are interested, please email me. I would be happy to chat! Education 2014–2023: PhD in Computer Science, Stanford University (Advisor: Alex Aiken) 2010–2014: BS in Computer Science and Mathematics, POSTECH Employment 2024–Present: Assistant Professor, POSTECH 2023–2024: Postdoctoral Associate, Carnegie Mellon University (Host: Feras Saad) 2017–2020: Researcher, KAIST (Host: Hongseok Yang) 2017: Research Intern, Microsoft Research India 2016: Research Intern, Microsoft Research Redmond Research Areas Programming Languages Machine Learning Continuous Computations Research Overview I aim to make foundational software more reliable and scalable. To this end, I pursue the following directions: Focus on fundamental programs and computations across diverse areas (e.g., machine learning, scientific computing). Prove their correctness, improve their efficiency, and understand their fundamental limits. For more details, see my group webpage and overview slides.
